evidences.name: Prosecutor's Badge
evidences.description1: Proof of my profession. However, I prefer to keep it in my pocket.

evidences.name: Crime Scene Notes
evidences.description1: Bullet went clean through the victim's abdomen. The body was found at around 2:05 AM.

evidences.name: Victim's Revolver
evidences.description1: It can be assumed that this gun is the murder weapon. It was issued to the victim.
evidences.description2: Issued to the victim and believed to be the murder weapon. Only 1 shot fired.

evidences.name: Secret Safe
evidences.description1: Each prosecutor has one in their office. Only they know of them. Trial evidence use.
evidences.description2: Each prosecutor has one in their office. Only they know of them. Prints were wiped.

evidences.name: Stolen File → Stolen 0-Series File
evidences.description1: One of the files that were written upon in blood was stolen by the culprit.
evidences.description2: Pages pertaining to a case tried 10 years ago by my predecessor are missing.

evidences.name: Master Key
evidences.description1: This can open every office door. Its use is controlled by security staff.
evidences.description2: This can open every office door. It was stolen from the security office.

evidences.name: Mr. Portsman's Office
evidences.description1: Ms. Byrde unlocked the door, but master key was stolen, so she could not lock it up.
evidences.description2: Ms. Byrde says she unlocked this door, but her prints were not found on the doorknob.

evidences.name: Basketball Hoop
evidences.description1: It's sitting in front of Portsman's office. There are signs that it's been moved.

evidences.name: Note Left by Victim
evidences.description1: Found under the door, for the absent Portsman.

evidences.name: Prosecutor's Badge
evidences.description1: Proof of my profession. However, I prefer to keep it in my pocket.

evidences.name: Travel Wallet → Mr. Hicks's Travel Wallet
evidences.description1: Picked up off the floor in front of the elevator. It isn't mine, so whose is it...?
evidences.description2: Picked up off the floor in front of the elevator. There is but a passport inside.

evidences.name: Crime Scene Notes
evidences.description1: Body found at 6:15 AM inside the elevator stopped at the first floor lounge.
evidences.description2: Body found at 6:15 AM inside elevator on 1st floor. Was hit on the back of his head.

evidences.name: Sky Magazine
evidences.description1: Details meals, movies, and other services inside.

evidences.name: Photo of Mr. Hicks
evidences.description1: Found in the victim's pocket. A souvenir picture, perhaps?
evidences.description2: Found in the victim's pocket. This was taken at a museum in Europe.

evidences.name: Missing Cell Phone → Mr. Hicks's Cell Phone
evidences.description1: The victim supposedly had one, but it has gone missing. Did the killer take it?
evidences.description2: The killer took this from the victim. It was found in Rhoda Teneiro's personal locker,
evidences.description3: The killer took this from the victim. There are pictures stored on this.

evidences.name: Captain Ugo Piggy Bank
evidences.description1: Usually on display at the in-flight shop. Found at the crime scene with blood on it.
evidences.description2: Found at the crime scene. Culprit must've shattered the display case to take it.
evidences.description3: This was taken out of its display case in the in-flight shop after the turbulence.

evidences.name: Grape Juice Footprints
evidences.description1: Spilt during the turbulence. Looks like footprints and something being dragged.

evidences.name: Refueling in Zheng Fa → Cargo from Zheng Fa
evidences.description1: Made a brief stop from 4 AM to 5 AM to transfer cargo and refuel at transfer point.
evidences.description2: It was loaded onboard during the refueling between 4 and 5 AM at the transfer point.

evidences.name: Ms. Meele's Testimony
evidences.description1: "Mr. Akbey Hicks was there in his seat when we took off again at 5 AM."

evidences.name: GoYou Suitcase
evidences.description1: This was used to transport the body. It was designed by Ms. Rhoda Teneiro.
evidences.description2: The Bloody Cloth was found inside. Highly likely killer got this from the cargo hold.

evidences.name: Bloody Cloth → Borginian Cloth
evidences.description1: Found inside the suitcase, its beautiful pattern has been soiled by blood.
evidences.description2: World-famous export of Borginia, its beautiful pattern has been soiled by blood.

evidences.name: Suitcase Receipt
evidences.description1: Bought at the in-flight shop and left in attendants' room. The timestamp says 5:40 AM.

evidences.name: Autopsy Report
evidences.description1: Instantaneous death resulting from blow to back of head. Bruising: head to mid back.

evidences.name: Alif Red Certificate
evidences.description1: Document written in Borginian. Proof the statue was loaded onboard in Europe.
evidences.description2: Document in Borginian. Says statue was loaded onboard in Europe, but statue is a fake.

evidences.name: Alif Red Statue
evidences.description1: Piece of art being shipped by Mr. Lablanc who claims it is worth 10 million cents.
evidences.description2: Fake piece being shipped by Mr. Lablanc. It was smuggled onboard in Zheng Fa.

evidences.name: Prosecutor's Badge
evidences.description1: Proof of my profession. However, I prefer to keep it in my pocket.

evidences.name: Gatewater Land Pamphlet
evidences.description1: Map and explanation of park attractions listed.

evidences.name: Bad Badger's Head
evidences.description1: Costumes separate into head and body. This head was left in the Isolation Room.

evidences.name: Blue Badger Bible
evidences.description1: Book detailing info on the whole Badger family.

evidences.name: Badger Photo Rally
evidences.description1: There's only 1 of each Badger in the park. Try to get the whole Badger family!

evidences.name: Stolen Costumes
evidences.description1: The kidnappers stole three costumes: a Blue, a Proto and a Bad Badger.
evidences.description2: Blue Badger = Lauren Paups Proto Badger = Lance Amano Bad Badger = Oliver Deacon

evidences.name: Preliminary Findings → Mr. Deacon's Murder Notes
evidences.description1: Victim: Oliver Deacon. Seems he was shot dead.
evidences.description2: Victim, Deacon, shot from ABD through shoulder.
evidences.description3: Body was moved. Shot from ABD through shoulder.

evidences.name: Mr. Deacon's Pendant
evidences.description1: It's shaped like a horse. "Colin Devorae" is engraved on the back.

evidences.name: Blue Badgermobile
evidences.description1: Mobile shop on three wheels. Was parked inside Wild, Wild West area garage.

evidences.name: Victim's Costume
evidences.description1: He was likely wearing one due to the footprints' shape and the lack of blood.
evidences.description2: Worn at the time of the shooting. Gunpowder burn is proof he was shot from point blank.

evidences.name: Love Letter
evidences.description1: Letter for Lance Amano. The sender is the "Tender Lender Loan Company".

evidences.name: Colin Devorae Dossier
evidences.description1: Details Oliver Deacon's real name and history.

evidences.name: Broken Prop Sword
evidences.description1: Was used to jam the handle to the hideout's door.
evidences.description2: Culprit hit me in the right temple area with this.

evidences.name: Missing Model Gun
evidences.description1: Was ripped from the Bad Badger costume. It's capable of firing blanks.

evidences.name: Ms. Paups's Pendant
evidences.description1: It's shaped like a pair of wings. "Lauren D." is engraved on the back.

evidences.name: Revolver
evidences.description1: Used to kill Deacon. Was originally stolen from guard by victim during escape.

evidences.name: Mirror Fragments
evidences.description1: These were found inside the victim's costume. Why were they there in the first place?
evidences.description2: Different from the mirrors on the walls. Very thick and has a design on the back.

evidences.name: Prosecutor's Badge
evidences.description1: Proof of my profession. My mentor said it was more chic to keep it in my pocket.

evidences.name: KG-8 Incident Overview
evidences.description1: Received from my mentor as reference about KG-8.

evidences.name: Det. Gumshoe's Testimony
evidences.description1: Was in hall on guard duty. Other than gunshot, didn't hear a sign of a struggle.

evidences.name: Handgun
evidences.description1: Was Faraday's evidence from Embassy staff killing case. It was found in his hand.
evidences.description2: Found in Faraday's hand. Bullet that killed Rell was fired from a few yards away.

evidences.name: Knife
evidences.description1: I believe Faraday brought this as evidence. It was found in Rell's hand.
evidences.description2: Weapon used to kill Faraday. Has the secret ability to change into key the Yatagarasu sent.

evidences.name: Crime Scene Notes
evidences.description1: Notes pertaining to Byrne Faraday and Mack Rell.

evidences.name: Plastic Bag
evidences.description1: One of the bags strewn on floor of Lobby No. 2. Has Faraday's blood on it.

evidences.name: Mr. Faraday's Fountain Pen
evidences.description1: Fountain pen used by the left-handed Faraday. Looks like it has a quality nib.

evidences.name: Annual Bonus Envelope
evidences.description1: Det. Gumshoe's annual bonus of $5. Literally had no money on him until he cashed this.

evidences.name: Swiss Roll
evidences.description1: Swiss roll dropped by the mysterious young girl. Says "Courthouse Special" on it.
evidences.description2: Swiss roll dropped by the mysterious young girl. It's priced at 2 for $6.
evidences.description3: Detective Gumshoe and Kay bought this Swiss roll together.

evidences.name: Det. Badd's Testimony
evidences.description1: He heard the gunshot right before the trial was about to start again.

evidences.name: Det. Gumshoe's Fingerprints
evidences.description1: Left on the hallway bench. Black smudge emits the scent of sweet sugar.
evidences.description2: Left on the hallway bench. Det. Gumshoe apparently sat here as he ate a Swiss roll.

evidences.name: Balloon Piece
evidences.description1: I just know I've seen a pink balloon around... Found on windowsill of the hallway window.
evidences.description2: Balloon popped by Kay. The Judge misheard its popping for a gunshot.

evidences.name: Promise Notebook
evidences.description1: Exchange diary between Mr. Faraday and Kay.

evidences.name: Ms. Yew's Perfume
evidences.description1: Perfume given to Badd by Yew. Same perfume as the one spilled in Lobby No. 1.

evidences.name: Mr. Faraday's Organizer
evidences.description1: Faraday wrote his strategy for winning in here.

evidences.name: Yatagarasu's Key
evidences.description1: Photo of key the Yatagarasu sent. Unusual shape.
evidences.description2: Photo of the key the Yatagarasu sent. Turns into knife.

evidences.name: Surveillance Video
evidences.description1: Video of the Embassy staff member's murder. Gunshot is especially impactful.

evidences.name: Prosecutor's Badge
evidences.description1: Proof of my profession. However, I prefer to keep it in my pocket.

evidences.name: Embassy Guide
evidences.description1: Two countries share this building with borders.

evidences.name: Steel Samurai's Autograph
evidences.description1: Autograph with a sketch of his face and weapon.

evidences.name: Notes on Coachen's Body
evidences.description1: COD: single stab to base of neck. The body wasn't badly burnt by the fire.

evidences.name: Yatagarasu's Key
evidences.description1: The Yatagarasu stole this from this embassy 7 years ago. It is also a knife.

evidences.name: Knife → Babahlese Knife → Allebahstian Knife
evidences.description1: Covered in victim's blood, the blade matches the wound. Butterfly motif is noteworthy.
evidences.description2: 1 of a set of 3 ornamental knives. Covered in victim's blood, blade same as wound.
evidences.description3: The blade is definitely Allebahstian. Was this carried across country lines?
evidences.description4: Blade determined to be Allebahstian. The flower motif's petals are separate.

evidences.name: Babahl's Primidux Statue
evidences.description1: Both countries claim to own real one. Nat. treasure. Only Amb. and Secret. can touch.
evidences.description2: It was a fake, but was swapped with the real one. Is originally from Allebahst.

evidences.name: Cohdopian Paper Document
evidences.description1: Accounting doc related to smuggling. Proof someone in 1 of the countries is ringleader.
evidences.description2: Doc related to smuggling of Babahlese ink. It appears to point to Mr. Coachen.

evidences.name: Babahlese Knife Handle
evidences.description1: Swapped with the real murder weapon's handle, its blade has yet to be found.

evidences.name: Counterfeit Bills
evidences.description1: Made with Babahlese ink, they are in circulation in Zheng Fa. It's hard to tell they're fake.
evidences.description2: Bills circulating in Zheng Fa. Made by Coachen. They were all burned up in Babahl.

evidences.name: Babahlese Ink
evidences.description1: Special whitcrystal oil-based ink. Limited export because of some specific reason.
evidences.description2: Special whitcrystal oil-based ink. Limited export because of its use in counterfeiting.

evidences.name: DeMasque II's Note
evidences.description1: Request for the theft of the Primidux Statue with a map to where the statue is.
evidences.description2: Request to steal the Primidux Statue. Same shape as notepad in Babahl office.
evidences.description3: Request to steal the Primidux Statue. Handwriting matches that of Manny Coachen.

evidences.name: Samurai Sword
evidences.description1: Weapon that's used on stage. Is thought to be what killed DeMasque II.

evidences.name: Photo with Steel Samurai
evidences.description1: Taken in front of Allebahst's Statue before murder.

evidences.name: Passionflowers
evidences.description1: Two large flowers in bloom. The vines are supported by stakes and are still growing.
evidences.description2: Two large flowers in bloom. Ambassador Alba takes great care in growing them.

evidences.name: Samurai Spear
evidences.description1: Weapon that's used on stage. Larry hit it against a wall and bent it. It's hollow.
evidences.description2: Because he bent it, Larry couldn't do the "Early Summer Rain Jab!" special attack.

evidences.name: Allebahst's Primidux Statue
evidences.description1: Both countries claim to own real one. Nat. treasure. Only Amb. and Secret. can touch.
evidences.description2: Both countries claim to own real one. Nat. treasure. Signs it was moved during murder.
evidences.description3: Bloodstained weapon used to kill DeMasque. Originally from Babahl's secretariat's office.
evidences.description4: Used to be real, but has been swapped with a fake from Babahl. Was used as a weapon.

evidences.name: Stand-In Request
evidences.description1: Request for Ms. Oldbag to stand in for Mindy, the Pink Princess actress who fell ill.

evidences.name: Letter from a Stalker
evidences.description1: For Ms. Oldbag. Has mistakes from bad penmanship.

evidences.name: Lady's Undershirt
evidences.description1: Found in office fireplace. There's only 1 person here who would own such a shirt.
evidences.description2: Found in office fireplace. Ms. Oldbag was drying it in the fireplace next door.

evidences.name: Samurai Dogs
evidences.description1: Present for embassy staff. Ms. Oldbag took and ate a few from the dressing room.

evidences.name: Silhouette Lantern
evidences.description1: Runs on whitcrystal oil, which burns green. It's a Babahlese souvenir.

evidences.name: Pick
evidences.description1: Found at the Open-Air Stage, it looks like a guitar pick. It's also wet for some reason.

evidences.name: Ms. Yew's Perfume
evidences.description1: This was left behind by Calisto Yew 7 years ago. Kay has been safe-guarding it.

evidences.name: Fountain Spouts
evidences.description1: Part of the Rose Garden pool. Auto-refills the water when the water level is too low.

evidences.name: Photo of Yatagarasu
evidences.description1: Taken from a building nearby at the moment of border crossing during the fire.
evidences.description2: Photo taken after the first fire on the 4th and 5th floors had taken place.

evidences.name: Fires in Babahl
evidences.description1: Two fires broke out in Babahl today.

evidences.name: Amb. Palaeno's Testimony
evidences.description1: Spilled Babahlese ink onto back wall while burning files in fireplace. Left ashes there.

evidences.name: Wire
evidences.description1: A good length of wire that was found wound up inside Babahl's grandfather clock.

evidences.name: Revolving Fireplace Wall
evidences.description1: There are signs that the revolving fireplace wall on Babahl's side has been used.

evidences.name: Hair Sticks → Crossbow Arrows
evidences.description1: Hair sticks with a candy stripe pattern on them. There is some dirt on the tips.
evidences.description2: Thought to be hair sticks, they're passionflower support stakes from Allebahst office.
evidences.description3: Neither hair sticks nor support stakes, they're actually crossbow arrows.

evidences.name: Trump Card
evidences.description1: Evidence from KG-8. Card containing orders from boss of smuggling ring to Coachen.

evidences.name: Video Tape
evidences.description1: Evidence from KG-8. Faraday had obtained it once, but Ernest Amano had it stolen.
evidences.description2: Evidence from KG-8. Footage showing Coachen entering the KG-8 Incident's crime scene.

evidences.name: Counterfeit Plate
evidences.description1: This was found from within the fake Primidux Statue Alba smuggled into his country.

evidences.name: Amb. Alba's Wound
evidences.description1: Mr. Alba claims it's proof he was stabbed by DeMasque II, so it was justified defence.

evidences.name: Commemorative Photo
evidences.description1: Taken at Theatrum Neutralis. The murder weapon can be seen in Mr. Alba's bouquet.

evidences.name: Security Footage
evidences.description1: Footage of the entranceways into Babahl and Allebahst from the Theatrum Neutralis.

evidences.name: Pushcart
evidences.description1: Steel Samural pushed this to Allebahst from the dressing room. The bulge is unnatural.
evidences.description2: Steel Samurai pushed this to Allebahst from the dressing room. There is blood inside.
